Reviews.Title: “my first stay, I rate it four, could be five”
Reviews.Author: Arzillo
Reviews.Content: My impression is limited, one night only, my first time there; however, If I go again, I might give five; considering the quality/price ratio: I payed 95 euro for a double room for single use large bed, good bed, large room; even if I was at the ground floor, it was very silent the building is well away from the street, so no traffic noise at all room style and furnishing is, let us say, a "classic", italian imitation renaissance?? probably nineteen century pastiche I had a wooden floor, very good for the feet good bathroom, large enough; marble; spotless clean breakfast on a terrace at the fourth floor, it reconciles you with life: a view on the roofs of the neigbourhood the breakfast itself, included, is kind of "standard" but quite complete and satisfactory (on confortable armchairs, yes !!!) the area is near the university, not really in the historical centre, but the metro stop "Policlinico" (line B) is just round the corner; from there you can reach both train stations where you can take a train to the airport; or you can go to "Colosseo" ; or change to line A for the centre many good points

Reviews.Title: “Villa Morgagni - home-from-home four-star hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: WilliamJo
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa Morgagni is very good value for money, as it is a charming four-star hotel in a central location and has been totally renovated. I paid 108 euros per night for a single including breakfast. Some colleagues at the conference I was attending stayed at the three-star hotels recommended by the organisers and paid almost as much as I did but their accommodation was decrepit. I don't know of any other four-star hotel in Rome that costs less than 150 euros at the standard rate. The Hotel Villa Morgagni is well connected as it is a one-minute walk from the Policlinico (hospital) station on Line B of the subway (Metropolitana or Metro) only two stops from Roma Termini, four stops from the Colosseum. Though not a prime tourist location (you can't just walk out of the front door and throw your small change into the Fontana di Trevi, as you can at the Hotel Fontana) I would recommend it as it is still central. The rooms and bathrooms have all been renovated to a very high standard and breakfast is up on the rooftop terrace, served by very helpful staff. Also they had unlimited internet access on the computer in the hotel lobby, that was very convenient. For the metro you can buy a one-day card for 4 euros, a three-day card for 11 euros, or a seven-day card for 16 euros. Be careful as there is another hotel in Rome called the Hotel Morgana that appears from the reviews to be totally decrepit. This one is Villa Morgagni (pronounced: mor-GAN-yee). Villa Morgagni has some political history attached to it as it used to be the home of Antonio Gramsci, but clearly there are a lot of buildings in Rome that have been home to political leaders. It was a very nice place to stay and I would definitely stay there again. Tel: -----------------

Reviews.Title: “Nice location to visit Rome...”
Reviews.Author: southernguyFL
Reviews.Content: We were a of 3. One double size bed and a sofa bed. The sofa bed was not that comfortable, but the bed was very good. The morning breakfast was a good continental breakfast. The one thing is you have to inform the desk if you plan to be out after 1AM, they close the gate and we stood outside for 10 mins before the overnight security respond to the buzzer on the gate. After we informed them that we would be out late, we had no other problems. We encountered on strange thing one late night, a male prostitute, but once we declined his offer, it was cool. The neighborhood seems safe and clean. The metro is about 1.5 blocks from the hotel. The night bus drops you off at the intersection near the hotel. There were local stores and laundry near by. Overall, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great value”
Reviews.Author: Herb559
Reviews.Content: Lovely, well-run little hotel, outside of the busy city center at the edge of a nice residential area but with metro, bus, and tram at the corner. Great breakfasts in a lovely setting, and a friendly and knowledgeable staff. Also--we recommend "Gran Sasso" restaurant, in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: ZivArgov
Reviews.Content: Not in a central location - but with easy access to Metro & buses. Termini is only 2 Metro stops away. Very quiet in the evening. Great staff. For dinner - make sure you go to 'Gran Sasso' restaurant - family owned with terrific food. 5 minutes walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't need to spend hours looking for hotels in Rome again, we'll be straight back!”
Reviews.Author: angeleyes100
Reviews.Content: Where to start? The booking process: we booked through an online agency and after receiving our confirmation number I made contact with the hotel straight away to confirm all was in order. I had barely time to check the rest of my emails before I received a reply from Federica at the hotel who gave me piece of mind that indeed we were booked in for the dates requested. On arrival the check in was straight forward and copies of our passport were taken and the key to our room handed over - all in all 5 minutes. The rooms were small, granted - but in my opinion, perfectly formed and the only thing I really care about is cleanliness and I couldn't fault it, it was spotless. If you want a bigger room pay the additional fee and upgrade but in my opinion if you spend hours in a hotel room in Rome, you're doing something wrong - how much room do you need to sleep?! The air conditioning system was excellent, the bed spacious and comfortable, there were extra pillows if required and above all the area was quiet. I had 7 great nights of sleep. Breakfast is exactly as I'd thought and I thoroughly enjoyed it and looked forward to it every morning. The setting was ideal, on the roof, open air and relaxing. There's loads of choice and Catia was there most mornings with a smile to greet you. After that, we left the room behind for the day and explored Rome. We asked Alessandra and Federica for tips on where to eat and because it was a Sunday Alessandra called ahead and checked that the restaurant was open. The restaurants recommended were very good and so if you're looking to eat out then either Stella Maris or Gran Sasso are both good choices. The staff at the hotel are helpful, pleasant and efficient and if you have experienced anything different then it may be worth bearing in mind that attitude begets attitude - if you're not pleasant, you won't get it back! All in all the stay at the hotel was an important part of our enjoyment of the Roma experience and they didn't disappoint. Thank you! Now for some useful tips: I did my research before we left for Rome and so I knew exactly where the hotel was located and checked google earth so that I would recognise the street and the hotel on arrival. When you get off the plane at Fiumincino Airport (FCO) there are plenty of signs for finding buses and trains into Rome. Be aware! We landed late evening when most of the ticket offices had closed and so we made our way to the one that was open so we could get a ticket for the Leonardo Express train. The man at the desk did everything possible to try and persuade us that the shuttle bus was the best option - even saying it would get us there quicker and that the trains were only every hour. We stuck to our guns and went for the train at which point he actually became quite hostile, telling us we were fools and that he knew better, blah blah. We boarded the train less than 10 minutes later (they are in fact every half an hour) and were at Termini Station in a squidge over 30 minutes. Follow the signs for the Metro, it is a bit of a trek but there are mechanical walkways for most of it so if you're tired, just stand still! At Termini Metro look for Linea B to Rebibbia and the hotel is located a stone's from Policlinico Station - 2 stops from Termini. We bought a weekly ticket that cost 16 euro and covered Metro, bus and tram - excellent value for money. The transport system makes it a doddle to get around. Don't be put off this hotel because you think it is out of town - its perfectly located.

Reviews.Title: “They Overbook!”
Reviews.Author: a l
Reviews.Content: Beware....we arrived to find they had already given our room away at 3 in the afternoon! They put us in a MUCH lesser hotel and made NO apologies or financial adjustments.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: sarlin5204
Reviews.Content: Right by Metro to city centre but nice and quiet. Excellent friendly and helpful staff. Can't wait to return. had a 9 year old boy with us so we wanted somewhere quiet but close to city centre. Breakfast on roof terrace was exceptional both in quality and surroundings

Reviews.Title: “"Clean and affordable"”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was approahable, friendly, helpful and spoke good english. The room was extremely clean and the breakfast was good, the standard European fare along with scrambled eggs and bacon. The location was in a quiet area around the university with not much night life and was not within walking distance of the center of Rome. You will need to take the metro (close) to Termini station in order to get to anything of interest. Overall, the stay was enjoyable however it is not within walking distance of the center of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and would come back”
Reviews.Author: kayeyo
Reviews.Content: I searched and searched the internet before my recent trip to Rome - so many hotels and so many opinions - I had settled on a few places and decided (all other things being equal) that Morgagni was the place to stay and I was so right! The staff is excellent - so polite and helpful and the room was immaculate and wonderful. The breakfast was typical European - but there were a few hot items as well - the breakfast room is quiet and elegant, simple with about the nicest staff around (will make you a specialty coffee, just ask). I was looking for reasonably affordable and I feel like I got a lot for the reasonable price - for me quiet location, clean, and helpful staff are key decision points within my modest price range and this place had it all. I would say the only con (if it is a con) is that the hotel as others have said is not in the center of Rome - but the bus really does stop out in front and the metro really is only a block or so away - also the pictures on the website excatly matched the real place - that was a relief! We were lucky enough to get a room with a balcony and it is about 2 times the size of the room! The room was small - but who cares - you are in Rome! The hotel staff was really great - a really nice touch after a long day of walking and sightseeing. This place really was an oasis in a nice residential neighborhood. It was no problem to take the metro every day to get to the sights. One non-hotel related tip - do not take the metro from the main train station to your hotel if your bags are heavy (we had only a few, but heavy bags) - the metro in Rome has almost no elevators and you will likely have to lug your bags up some serious stairs - and there about a zillion people to navagate through - pay for a taxi from the main Termini station - your back will thank you.

Reviews.Title: “could be better!”
Reviews.Author: luzurich
Reviews.Content: I went with my parents and husband, the first part of the trip was ok, the rooms where clean and the staff where not that unfriendly. After one night we wanted a drink from the bar but Giovanni didn't know how to prepare the drinks they had in the menu. Tthe new girl at the front desk wasnt as patient as the first one. the breakfast was fine, but after 4 days eating the same you get tired of it. My husband went back home and I stayed longer with my parents, I forgot my umbrella in the room, but one told me anything (I thought my husband took it because it was raining so I realized it one week later that I left it there) and I moved to another room not that honest cleaning staff. After our trip to Matera we came back for one night and the triple room had a huge extra bed, it was so difficult to move around, very uncomfortable. The Internet was 4 eur. the hour, very expensive comparing the other hotels we visited. we had free Internet in all of them. The hotel didn't have a restaurant so we have to go out for dinner. The pros are that they have a metro station really close and is very quite. rooms are ok and the decor is very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but verrry small.”
Reviews.Author: i_thornton
Reviews.Content: As said in the other reviews, this hotel is set off the street and quiet. It is considered a 'luxury' hotel by Rome standards, and it was nice, yes. But it was extremely small. If my wife and I had to walk past each other you had to turn sideways. You couldnt carry a rolling bag into the room because there was a footstool in the corner blocking the path (i have no idea why). The bathroom was also very small, with no shower curtain, only a small piece of glass to 'stop' the water splashing. Trendy? Yes. Functional? No. Water went all over the floor and out into our living space. Long story short, the hotel was nice, and the breakfast was good up on the terrace. But having to take a bus or the subway literally everywhere instead of being able to walk was kind of a bother. I probably wouldnt stay here again just because the room was so tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of front desk staff and overcharging for phone calls.”
Reviews.Author: roverino
Reviews.Content: Good things-breakfast and the room itself. However there is no wireless internet , and wired did not work in our room. You have to pay 4 euros/hour to use internet anyway, and the only place we could do it, was computer in the lobby. There is no iron in the hotel, that you could use ( I could not beleive it). After arguing for 15 min, I was allowed to iron my 2 shirts downstairs in some conference room. And, lastly, really mean front desk lady was trying to get 28 euros from me for a 3 minute phone call I placed from the room. Parking is 15 euros/night, and I did not get a receipt. I am pretty sure she pocketed this money. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: traveldizzy
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay and they were happy to give us the same room as was in 2007. Villa Morgagni a 4star a beautiful small hotel tucked in a safe neighbourhood few yards from Policlinico Metro station straight to Termini. We absolutely love this hotel, the staff are friendly, corteous and very welcoming. Thanks to Katia and Alessandra who have made us a great stay during the time. There is a breakfast rooftop with nice view and with good choice of continental breakfast. Helps to fill us up especially when visiting sites most of the day. There are 2 nice restaurants La Limonaia and La Mimosa walking distance which are worth visiting (hotel are more than happy book reservations for you). We prefer staying here, away from all the hussle and bussle especially for a good night sleep. Thank you Hotel Villa Morgagni again. Will definitely recommended to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaLR
Reviews.Content: Situated 100 yds from a Metro stop, this hotel was excellent. Set slightly back, quiet, with excellent service. The front of house staff were always very helpful and friendly. The room was spacious, tastefully decorated, well maintained and clean. The bathroom was also lovely. Breakfast on the rooftop terrace was included and was fresh and had a wide variety of food. Also reasonable priced. In Rome this is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katzzmcd
Reviews.Content: In the 5 hotels we stayed in on our trip, the Villa Morgagni was the best one. Clean, spacious, polite. The room was as described. The bathroom was spacious and clean with plenty of amenities and a real hairdryer. The bed was comfortable and the comforter was clean. The concierge was always polite and very helpful with recommendations and directions. Breakfast was an average spread and always plenty of tables. 3 minute walk to the Policlinico metro stop and there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. Quiet at night. Perfect for a stay in Rome. Nothing over the top fancy but just what you need after long days touring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: DonnaChris
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Expedia, and it was absolutely perfect for us. It was off the busy street, tucked into a residential neighborhood. An excellent value, it was quaint, tidy, and I cannot praise the desk staff enough. They "do it all" including exceptional concierge services. I booked a "deluxe" standard room, based on reviews that I read noting some of the rooms were too small. It was sufficient; it had the desk needed by my companion for work on his laptop, as well as internet access. The bath had a shower and jacuzzi tub. The included breakfast was satisfying, incorporating both hot and cold choices of eggs, assorted cereals, pastries, cheeses, fruits, coffee and the like. Above all, and the primary reason I chose this particular hotel, was its placement very near a Metro station that was only two stops from Termini Station. We became experts of the Metro and bus lines in short order, which allowed us complete access to the entire city. There are few eateries nearby, but the hotel personnel directed us to a fabulous, family-run restaurant a couple of blocks away, that is enjoyed by the locals. It was so delicious, we dined there a couple of times. Our arrival was called ahead by the hotel, and we received outstanding hospitality. Without question, between this lovely hotel, and the tours we booked with Context Travel, well, our visit truly was a Roman Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “"Nearly a four star"”
Reviews.Author: bertmandelieu
Reviews.Content: The main criticism concerned the bathroom which was not up to scratch. The "jacuzzi" bath never worked but that did not concern us as we do not like them but for others..... The bath itself was uncomfortable. The other main problem a was the very very low wattage bulbs in both the room and the bathroom; you need "cats eyes" to read. Breakfast was adequate but unimaginative bearing in mind we were there in full fruit season. However the staff were first class, the location very, very quiet and only 200 Yards from a Metro Station (Policlinico). Bearing in mind the price we paid for "hotel and flight" deal from S.N.C.F. travel service, it was good value for money - the rack rate is another matter.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: EuropeExplorer18
Reviews.Content: I booked for 4 nights at this hotel month's ago. Upon arrival, I was told the hotel was overbooked and need to transfer us to another hotel for 1 night. Overall, the hotel met our expectation. Nearby Metro and bus stops to city center, clean room, excellent front staff and quiet neighborhood. The improvement I would like to see is the room itself. The lights are few and dark. Only two shaded lights above bedside table and one above the mirror. The hard wood floor looks dull and needs polishing probably due to heavy human traffic. The only drawback is Rome's Metro is not user friendly for traveler with luggage. Be aware that you may have to carry your luggage up and down the stairs to get to the platform.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: richardWooreCheshire
Reviews.Content: the hotel was ideally placed being close to the metro and an easy trip from the station.the hotel staff were polite and helpful and the rooftop location for breakfast was an ideal start to the day.Would definately recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but...”
Reviews.Author: acdcparis
Reviews.Content: Out of the strict tourist area - which makes it quite relaxing at night - it's still in a walking distance of the Termini station and tourist sights (if you're not too lazy). The personnel is kind and charmed when you speak some italian (a general point in Italy). My room was impressively small and does not make you want to stay in more the required time (sleeping, relaxing after a long day walk). It's more or less clean. But again, too small a room to make it pleasant. Low point : walls between rooms are very thin (glad i'd some quite neighbours). The spa is available only on payment of a fee (15 euros). High point : breakfast served on the top floor. General : the hotel is located in a rather quiet area (even though some work is undergoing in a close building which can make it noisy at times).

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel with wonderful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Holidaylover091
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a proposed weekend break as the Iceland Volcano erupted. The rooms, while a little on the small side, are beautifully decorated, and the bathrooms are modern with good facilities. We had the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in and the whole hotel is spotlessly clean with a high level of comfort. Breakfast is buffet style, and is served on the top floor terrace. There is a good selection and plenty of it. You need to ask the waitress for expresso or cappucino, otherwise there is a flask of coffee on the buffet. The hotel is a little out of town, but the bus to the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps stops almost outside (other routes too) and the Metro to Termini Station (The main transport hub and bus station) is a couple of minutes walk. During our time at the hotel, air transport was made impossible due to the volcano. We were allowed to keep our room at the same internet rate, and the reception staff could not have been more helpful. They went out of the way to assist with telephone calls, internet access and suggestions. They kept our morale up, and were so friendly and supportive we found it very hard to leave when the time came. Our eternal thanks for making a bad situation a little easier to handle. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who likes a little comfort at an affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Hans55
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure to stay at Villa Morgagni for a week in June 2009. Location was perfect, in a very peaceful area, but just a minute walk from the Metro, and a lot of nice restaurants within walking distance. Room was spacious, clean, nice and quiet. Staff very nice and helpful. Breakfast buffet was more than enough on top floor. Will definately stay here next time we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasure in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Froggy80
Reviews.Content: We travel frequently and I use Trip Advisor as well as other sites to review hotels. I write my reviews with care and accuracy...enjoy. Villa Morgagni was an incredible delight. The rooms that have been upgraded (I understand some have not) were the rooms my family occupied. We took 3 rooms for 3 nights and there wasn't a flaw. Each room was decorated in traditional Italian (hotel) oppulance. While some Americans think this comes straight out of Gammy and Gampy's house, all I can say is that they should be so lucky! With polished mahogany floors, marble baths with large Jacuzzi tub-showers, large windows to a balcony (view to nowhere in particular)...we were more than satisfied. In fact, this was the first hotel of three that I selected for a 2 week trip with the family. The biggest critic (b**ch) is my sister-in-law and, much to my RELIEF, she loved it! That was the equivilent to a Michelin star. Bravo! While we were there, I left my iPhone (with my life history in it...there's a lesson there) in a taxi. I discovered it only moments after the cab dropped us off at the hotel. I think my gasp got the attention of the concierge/receptionist who went into full-court press to help me out. To add a little pressure to the scenario, our driver was picking us up in one hour and taking us to our ship for an overnight passage to Sicily. (See Grimaldi Line review) She pulled out all stops, called ALL the cab companies (because "moi" did not get a receipt) and, miracle of miracles...the driver appeared about 30 minutes later with my iPhone. Oh, did I forget to mention that we tipped him well for the trip he had just given us? Bingo! It paid me back in spades that day and he earned an extra special bonus for his honesty and beyond-the-call service, too. The night clerk also recommended a restaurant for a special birthday dinner the night before. I hoped that it wasn't her cousin's latest attempt to avoid the dole...boy, am I becoming a cynic or what? As it turned out, we dined in one of the finest fish restaurants in the city of Rome and, best of all, owned by a Sardinian, which made the experience that much more unique. So, as far as I can say, the rooms, the beautiful breakfast on the rooftop terrace with its polite staff, the concierge and the hotel facility in general (beautiful bar, too) are to be highly recommended by this traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Lissu83
Reviews.Content: Great staff and great breakfast. The location is not central, but the metro is very close. I recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Glad I trawled the Internet to find this hotel .”
Reviews.Author: chrisnorthwales
Reviews.Content: Room lovely, bathroom excellent and roomy, lots of hot water. Service very good, very good buffet breakfast including bacon and eggs, pastries, cereals, fruit etc etc. I was a solo traveller and did not feel at all uncomfortable there. The hotel is only 50 metres from Policlinico metro which was only 2 stops from the mainTermini station, the hotel is not isolated at all but is far enough away to allow you to escape the city centre bussle and sleep at night whilst still being right on its doorstep and only 5 minutes away, loads of public transport. Reasonably priced 4 star hotel. I spent 2 weeks trawling the Internt to find the right hotel at the right price and was glad I did so, will definately return. Travel kettle is a must wherever you go !

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: DuoVogis
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there 3 nights, we've really enjoyed our stay. The hotel staff is very kind and makes you feel comfortable. Our room was lovely, very clean, functional (air-conditionning system, flat TV) and nicely decorated. You can't hear the traffic outiside because the windows are well isolated. Breakfast was excellent, they have a large choice of pastries, croissants and cakes, served in a nice terrace at the top of the hotel, . The hotel is located close to the Policlinico station, which is very convenient for any trip inside/outside the city.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but small”
Reviews.Author: ariooo
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, close to the subway and only 2 stops away from the Colosseum. Rooms clean but tend to smell very much of cleaning agents, luckily u can open the windows!!! Rooms VERY small but nice and they have cofortable beds. Since the hotel is right next to a farly big street there is a lot of traffic noise but the windows manage to make up for that very good. The breakfast is very nice with a view from the roof top. The cappucino is excellent, be sure to ask for it from the breakfast hostess. Staff very friendly and helpful, internect access is very expensive. 4EUR for 1hour. Also check-out time a bit too early (11 am.). Overall I would recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Rome although I wish we'd be more central so you wouldn't have to change trains at Termini stations wherever you're going.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: WendyinAlexandria
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Hotel Villa Morgagni October 10-12, 2009 and we were so pleased with our selection. The hotel itself is beautiful - our rooms were large, with comfortable beds, nice linens, soft towels and plenty of upscale toiletries. Because it is set off the street a bit, it is VERY quiet! Like a little oasis in Rome. A luxury for us having just spent 5 nights in Florence on a very busy street. We had the outdoor terrace to ourselves - like a private patio. Perfect place to enjoy a bottle of wine and some snacks that we brought with us, and the hotel even arranged for some take out chicken nuggets for the kids. While it is off the beaten path a bit, it's a very easy and quick metro or bus ride into the action. Even my 78 year old father thought it was easy! The best part of the hotel was the service. Everyone was so helpful and kind and truly made our brief stay all the more enjoyable. In fact, when they heard we were ripped off by taxi drivers charging us more than double for the ride from the train station, they arranged for a shuttle to the airport at a significant discount. We were given complimentary bottles of water for the ride, and even offered free cappucinos. I highly recommend this hotel if you don't feel like you need to be in the middle of the action and want a peaceful place to hang your hat in chaotic Rome. And if service is important, then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: PGilchrist
Reviews.Content: A good hotel to use as a base for exploring Rome. The Metro is less than 5 minutes away and will quickly get you many places inside the city. Room was an OK size with a nice clean bathroom. Absolutely zero view out the window, but I wasn't in Rome to look out the hotel window. There are a few places to eat around the hotel, less touristy and good food. Overall a good clean hotel. A little surprised to find that the two glasses of wine at the bar were $26! The breakfast was fine, nothing fancy.

Reviews.Title: “Great place off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: Phluffy024
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the price and the reviews from tripadvisor as well as a number of other travel sites. First, and most importantly, this hotel is a bit outside where many of Rome's attractions are situated. It took us about 30 minutes to walk to the ancient part of the city, which isn't bad but can be irritating after a long day of site seeing. The good thing is the hotel is a 2 minute walk from the metro and the bus stops right outside, which made everything much more convenient. The room itself was clean, spacious, and the bed was quite comfortable. There was a number of balconies that don't provide much of a view, but are very nice for enjoying the weather and sipping on cappucino. The breakfast was adequate offering a number of brioche, cereals, and a couple of mediocre hot options; make sure you ask for a cappucino as the "American Coffee" is not very good. The staff was very friendly, helpful, and everyone spoke english. Internet is available, but costs 4e/hr. Overall, this is the perfect place if you want to save some cash but stay in a very nice hotel AND if you are ok with either a walk or taking public transportation to get to and from the sites (each way on the metro is 1e...not too bad).

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in Roma!”
Reviews.Author: dgat2
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from another great trip to Italy. We stayed at this hotel and were extremely happy with everything about it. Our room was spacious and very clean, furnishings were fresh and well done, and the bathroom was very large with a jetted tub. The location was a little out of the way from center of the city (we prefer that), however it was just a one minute walk to the metro stop, the bus stopped right in front of the hotel, and the street was very quiet at night. The staff was very helpful and always friendly. Breakfast was pretty much the usual fare but always well presented and plentiful. I would definitely recommend this hotel for those who have been to Roma before and are looking for a quiet, neighborhood-type place to stay while enjoying the charm of this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Thailandl0ver
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at this hotel. The receptionists (especially Francesca) are extremely nice and helpful and speak good English. Our room was spacious with a table, coffeetable, small sofa and good size cupboard for clothes. It was all very clean. The bathroom is more than big enough, with bathtub, toilet and bidet. Airco in the room works fine. The breakfast buffet on the 4th floor (on the roof, you eat outside but in the shade) was lovely with plenty of choice. The staff there also very nice. The location of this hotel is great, only a few minutes walk from metro station Policlinico (only two stops from main railway station Termini). The metro will take you to a lot of tourist sights or at least close to them. Bus 61 stops in front of the hotel and there's also a tram stop across the street (not sure which numbers stop there). Be aware that the bus network is the most extensive in terms of public transport, the metro network is not as developed as in other main European cities (e.g. London, Paris) - there are only two lines. These two function perfectly though and metro's arrive very frequently. Two minor disadvantages: it seems that when you take a shower at a busy hour (i.e. multiple guests use the showers in their rooms at the same time) the shower gets cold every couple of minutes. I found this a bit annoying. Also the door doesn't have an easy lock very to lock it from the inside, you have to really check which way you turn the little handle underneath the door handle. If you turn it the wrong way it actually opens the door instead of closing it - I found the door to our room wide open in the middle of the night because I had turned it the wrong way and didn't check it. Make sure to double check! I always like one of those little chain locks better anyway. Overall we had a great experience here and we definitely recommend this lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We recommend it.”
Reviews.Author: aliceandchris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed at this hotel about a week ago. The trip from the metro was really easy and check-in was a breeze. Our room was very clean and well-appointed. Nice wooden floor, nice bathroom. Breakfast was included and there were lots of options for what you could eat.

Reviews.Title: “just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: bigcheuk
Reviews.Content: great location - away from the traffic noise and hordes of central Rome, yet only a short metro ride (station 100m away) to the main attractions. Bus stop right outside as well. Very good bar just over the road, with excellent Tavola Calda, panini, drinks etc at very reasonable prices. This hotel was just as their website said - very comfortable, beautifully maintained, friendly staff. We had a "Smart" room (201) which was larger than usual, had a whirlpool bath, settee, desk and coffee table, and a large terrace which was perfect for sitting out late at night to cool down. Breakfast was pretty good, usual European style - lots of cold choice, bacon and scrambled eggs were only hot options, but in the heat not really necessary. Only down side was TV didn't have a signal for two days, but again why go to Rome to watch TV. Also, receptionist sent us to a local restaurant she recommended and insisted was open on Sundays - it wasn't. Overall, great value for just under £110 per night, well worth the extra for larger room . Don't stay here if you want the touristy buzz of the city centre, but if you want a relaxing oasis not far away this is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Roxy_tri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my two friends in October 2008 on a five day trip to Rome. On arrival, front of house staff were most accomodating. His name escapes me at the moment but the man who helped us settle in to this wonderful little hotel even helped us out with ordering in food to the hotel as we were tired and not in the mood to go searching for food! Breakfast was on a rooftop terrace with great views overlooking the city. The location of this hotel is not exactly central but it is located on a metro stop which will bring you anywhere you need to go within the city. Our room was spotless, very comfortable and decorated in the most luxurious fashion. Had a very enjoyable stay here and would recommend to anyone visiting Rome as it most reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Clean small hotel, but needs a bit of upgrading work”
Reviews.Author: Mehdi_Meghdadi
Reviews.Content: Don't take me wrong, I have definitely seen much worse in Italy. For the night of Champions League final just finding this nice and clean room in Roma, not specifically known for it's hotels (!!!), was a miracle but don't have huge expectation. Check in and check out was very easy and the lady was extremely nice and helpful. The rooms are nicely done but then there is no proper TV and the water system needs a bit of homework before you can take a shower. The breakfast is very simple and if you want some really nice Italian treat you should forget about the breakfast included in your room rate. Overall a good experience, easily accessible by Metro or bus and a quick taxi ride from downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Not so superior...”
Reviews.Author: asabella
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations as I booked Superior Deluxe Double room. But my room was in the bottom floor, actually below ground level. Room was very plain and not very big. Nothing superior about it, just a double bed, desk and chair and one armchair. Bathroom was fine, but jacuzzi stopped working. The area was very quiet and safe, breakfast was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, stylish good value hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Rose020
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. Extremely comfortable and stylish- felt like a home from home. Excellent value for money. While near a busy road (you can't really escape the traffic in Rome) the hotel is extremely quiet. Away from the centre of Rome but in a good residential area, and metro to centre just round the corner. Excellent park nearby. Good breakfast room on top floor with good view - only drawback was the snooty catering manageress - who had gave the impression the job and guests were beneath her!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant quiet, comfortable and clean.”
Reviews.Author: glj8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel 20/23 March 2009. The staff were very friendly and helpful and spoke excellent english. Lovely breakfast on roof terrace kept us going all day. The metro is only over the road and easy to use buy the three day pass. You can walk to most things but it is about half hour to first attraction. Tour buses and taxis expensive and you will see much more on foot. The rooms vwere very clean and nicely furnished but standards a bit small, we upgarded to delux room 305 very well worth the extra. Will stay here again and recommend 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in Rome”
Reviews.Author: cagdas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Villa Morgagni for 4 days in September. We had a good deal via Venere.com so it was a reasonable choice before we go. I'd read all the reviews before we left and agree with all the good points. Reception kind and friendly, very helpful. We didn't eat around the hotel but there is a small cafe just round the corner on via treviso, 3 tables outside on the pavement nothing fancy. Good coffee for 70 cents, cappucino for 90 cents. It's lovely in shade and you feel you are in "real" Rome which is a hard find in tourist oriented central Rome. Now back to Hotel; the rooms are lovely, so are the bathrooms. Walls are covered with fabric and everywhere is increadibly clean. Breakfast on the terrace is wonderful and yes you need to ask for "Italian coffee" or cappucino. American coffee they keep on the table is not very nice. Breakfast was varied with pastry and fruits. Hotel is very close to a metro station and you can stopover at Termini station on the way for whatever you need, any time of the day. Good walking shoes and Rome Pass are essential if you are staying more than a day. Don't think twice before booking this hotel if you are after informal comfort, easy to reach location and taste of the real city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel-Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Alison-Michael
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Villa Morgagni for four nights in July before moving on to Florence. We booked using 'Expedia'. The hotel is situated quite far out from the city of Rome. However, it is very close to a tube station which does give speedy access to the centre. We took the tram into central Rome a couple of nights. There are a couple of lovely restaurants just a few stops away from the hotel and the area was safe to walk through at night. The hotel itself is very nice with friendly staff. Our room was extremely small, but well presented and very clean. The shower room was tiny, but again clean with plenty of towels and toilettries. Breakfast was served on the roof terrace and there was a very good variety of foods available. Although this is a good hotel I would not stay in it again due to location. We had a lovely time in Rome and visited all the usual sights-Vatican, Colloseum, Trevi Fountain, etc. Tip if first time visiting Rome-do not purchase a 'Roma Pass' unless you are intending to visit many museums (as it offers very little else). It doesn't even allow entry into the Vatican Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and safe location”
Reviews.Author: chrisr34000
Reviews.Content: The Villa Morgagni is very well located: you have to walk only 2 minutes (300 m) from the metro station Policlinico (Line B) to the hotel. The location is very safe; we were strolling in the area late at night and there was nothing which would let us feel in danger. The hotel has 4 floors, whereas the 4th floor is the terrace where you are served breakfast. The room was nice and very clean (small, but not tiny). The air conditioning is a must if you are in Rome during summer and this hotel offers it in every room. The staff is very friendly and helpful. I asked the receptionist to make me a reservation for the Galleria Borghese and it was no problem (the only way to do ONLY a reservation for the Galleria Borghese is by phone!). The breakfast (served between 7.00 and 10.30) here is fantastic, we were really pleasantly surprised by the variety offered to us. There is also a turkish bath in the underground, but you have to pay for it. A small disadvantage is the fact that the nearest metro station (Policlinico) is served by the Line B and you'll have to change at Termini to Line A to get to almost all tourist attractions (except the Colosseum which on the track of Line B). This will cost you some time and energy and you will not want to be very often in the Termini station because it smells badly and you're risking to get pickpocketed. Another downside is that you have to pay (4 Euros/hour) to use their computer in the lobby (though they offer WiFi in your room if you bring your notebook, I believe). If you are looking for a supermarket in Rome (in case you want to pay 1.60 for a 1,5 L coke instead of 4-5 Euros in the center), you'll encounter some serious trouble, because there are almost none or very hard to find if you don't know exactly where to go (at least in August). Here are some we found along the way: 1) Near Pantheon on Via Giustiana 2) On some small street which ends in Piazza Navona 3) http://www.supermercatigs.it for GS Supermarkets

Reviews.Title: “Resonable price but no frills what so ever”
Reviews.Author: lt.ripley
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here for five nights in July. We wanted something at a reasonable price, not to faraway from the city. We payed about a total of 350 euro for the whole stay. Room The room we got was small and with a tiny bathroom. When we first enter the room it smelled a bit funky (every day), almost like mold, but that smell disappered fast, I guess we got used to it. But I sneezed a lot during our stay. Aircondition in room was great. The room is very old-fashioned decorated with like paisley-cloth and stuff. Bed was comfy. Cleaning good. We found no hotelinformation on the room, like how much the minibar costed and so on. The TV did not work properly. Breakfast Breakfast was good, on the terrace with fresh fruit, cereal, eggs, lots of sweets, yoghurts. You could also get great italian coffee if you asked the staff! =) Reception The staff at the reception was ok. They did there job but not really much more. No queues at checking in or out. Surroundings The area around the hotel is kind of boring. We found no shops etc. But there is a great little pizza-place nearby where you can buy great, cheap pizza. The hotel is really close both to buses and Metro, just 2-3 minutes away. Two metro-stops from Termini (centralstation), where you have to switch if you're going to everywhere else but the Colosseum. It's easy to travel by Metro, Rome only has two lines. So, location is quite good for being in the outskirts, and we were pleased with the cost. But we felt like we got what we payed for, nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient to the Metro”
Reviews.Author: amycat06
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Villa Morgagni for three nights in May. The location is great -- although it's not in the center of the city, it's right around the corner from the Policlinico metro stop. The metro is cheap, simple to figure out, and essential because Rome sprawls. The staff at Villa Morgagni were helpful and spoke excellent English. We booked a deluxe double room which included a jetted Jacuzzi. After exploring Rome all day, getting into the tub at the end of the day and putting feeling the jets massage my feet made the upgrade worth every penny! The room was nicely furnished with a minibar and flat screen TV, although the only English-language channel was the ever-present CNN World News. My only major gripe was the fact that the our shower water temperature fluctuated MAJORLY during every shower that both my husband and I took. I spent the entire time adjusting the lever so that I would be neither scalding nor freezing cold (and was rather unsuccessful). This made for some rushed and very unenjoyable showers. Breakfast in the morning was great and I really liked the rooftop setting. Overall, a good experience, and I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Les91
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely first rate and was very well located in a nice quite area yet only minutes walk from the Metro and on a number of bus routes. The room was small, as is common in Rome, but was very nicely decorated and spotlessly clean. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a good choice. The location on the roof patio was lovely and like the rest of the hotel was spotlessly clean and bright. The staff were friendly and helpful, with for example the night porter happy to provide a drink from the bar "as long as the request was simple as he was not a trained barman" Nothing was any trouble. Would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly go back if in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: atlbrent
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wonderful rooms and a beautiful breakfast. We loved our stay and the staff was very helpful. It is located outside of the busy city center and allows for easy access to all the sites via the metro trains. Lots of walking in Rome and this hotel being close to the train station (Policlinico station) makes it very easy. One note for any travel in europe no matter the length of time...PACK LIGHTLY. Navigating from the main rome station to the metro and all of the stairs with lots of luggage can test even the best travelers. Pack light and spare yourself the trouble (One carry-on). Ask the front desk for restaurants. Gran Sasso was a great family place with excellent food. Try the antipasto. Again, the rooms in this hotel were much better than others we had seen and we felt very safe. If flying out of Fumicino airport (a madhouse of confusion), it is best to have a driver take you to and from the hotel rather than taking the cattle car to the airport. It will cost you around 50 euro but definitely worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: MarcV6
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at Villa Morgagni and had a positive experience. Arrived a little after 10 in the morning and immediately got a room, were greeted very friendly by the staff (got a map, tour brochures, dinner recommendations, information on metro & bus etc). We ended up going to two of the recommended restaurants which both were at least ok, second very nice with prosecco and additional starters on the house etc). The room was smallish but nice and very clean with a big bathroom. Only minor complaint was the shower water temperature which varied somewhat constantly. The breakfast room on the top floor was nice with everything you needed for a good start of the day, although always the same content (would have liked darker breads, maybe fruit salads). Metro stop was a 3min walk away, during the days very easy to use although mostly a line change at Termini had to be done (if going to Spanish steps, Trevi, Vatican etc). Some sort of work was done to this line starting Jan 2008 which caused the line to close already at 21.30. This meant you had to take the bus in the evenings when returning home from dinner. On the Sunday the bus 61 didn't seem to run and also other days it seem to run infrequently. On the Sunday we had to take a taxi which didn't cost us too much. On the whole a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: AnneKildare
Reviews.Content: My Husband & I stayed here for a short break early Dec. A beautiful hotel, helpful, friendly staff. Rooms were on the small side, but we were there for the sights, and the room was so comfortable (incl bed and pillows!!). Lovely bathroom. Great breakfast in the terrace (7-1030) A 15 minute walk from the centre of town, perfect! We took the bus into the Termini (8 euro each) and a taxi to the hotel (10 eu) from Campioni Airport even tho the hotel offered a shuttle (60 eu). We did take the taxi on our return to Fiumichino (50 eu) although there is a train from the Termini at 11 eu per person. It runs every 30mins and takes 30mins to get to the Airport. Advice: Get to the Airport early. Checkin staff can be quite 'laid back'. It took us a whole 2 hours from checkin to boarding..no time for duty free shopping!! Will definately stay here again and look forward to it!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb boutique hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: honty
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a romantic getaway with my girlfriend this Summer and it more than lived up to expectations. The hotel is set back from the street, so you don't hear any noise from nearby traffic and it located very close to a metro stop. This metro stop makes getting to the major sites within the city easy as pie - reviewers who have claimed that this hotel is located 'in the middle of nowhere' must either have wanted rooms above the Spanish Steps (in which case they should expect noise and high prices) or they were, frankly, a little reticent to travel beyond the end of the street. Our room, while not massive, was spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated. The bathroom was also well-equipped and clean. I note a previous reviewer's gripe about the beds; we thought they were extremely comfortable, though they are on the firm side. Given that there is air con in all rooms, the issue of needing a blanket seems little moot - the room temp was always good for us, because we set it ourselves! Breakfast on the roof terrace was a continental affair, which was plentiful, tasty and relaxing - nothing stellar, for sure, but a nice way to start the day and as good as I have had elsewhere in Roman hotels. The staff were also very helpful, recommending restaurants and routes around the city...the Siciliando restaurant they recommended was a particularly good choice, being a non-touristic place to enjoy real Sicilian-style cooking on a beautiful roof terrace, which was perfect in the summer. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to couples visiting Rome and looking for a well-located, comfortable and good-value base for exploring this most captivating of cities.

Reviews.Title: “Far from everything, close to the metro line B”
Reviews.Author: lovetobeinparis
Reviews.Content: The biggest problem with this hotel, that no one has mentioned ,was the bedding. The mattress and the pillow was as hard as a rock. We had such a difficult time sleeping every night. There was no blanket or anything on the bed. I called to see if they had a different kind of pillow,but they didn't. Their standard room was the smallest room we have ever stayed anywhere. There was two inch space between the bed and the wall !! The breakfast was fine. The hotel is in middle of nowhere. We walked around to see if there was a market around and we couldn't find anything. The staff spoke english well,but didn't have much knowledge about much. On the positive side, the hotel was a short walk away from the metro and the bathroom was nice and for this reasons alone I choose the hotel. I don't think the hotel is worth the price. We were facing the street and it wasn't that quite. I will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautyfull and small hotel!”
Reviews.Author: girl27norway
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in our fantastic trip to Rome. The hotel is very small and cosy, and have a nice atmosphere. The room was very small, but it was absolutly wonderfully decorated! It was also very clean. The location was great if you dont mind taking the metro to get places. It was the mainline metro that was closest to the hotel, and it only took about 10 min to get to Coliseum. The hotel is not close to the road, it was nice and quiet in the neighbourhood. Not any restaurants or shops nearby, but like I said, not far with the metro. I was a bit disappointed with the breakfast, but from the looks of the other rewies, they might have changed the poor selection. I would defenitly stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful tiny room, ice breakfast, good location”
Reviews.Author: minibargrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the this hotel in July 2007, during a major heat wave! The hotel is very adorable from the outside, but th elobby is almost nonexistant. Our room was VERY TINY, but very beautiful. The walls were padded with fabric, very luxurious! The A/C was amazing in this hotel, and kept us very cool! However, we experienced multiple power outages and a very loud fire alarm at 2am that lasted for about an hour. The front desk staff was pretty hostile, and was very annoyed with us every time we called to find out why the A/C was broken. They were even rude to us at one point, because our room card stopped working - not our fault! They also had no restaurant recommendations, which we thought was odd, don't guests ask them for that all the time? The breakfast was great at this hotel, and the rooftop patio was lovely! The location close the the metro was great !

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: topcat1973
Reviews.Content: I arrived at ciampino airport and jumped into a taxi. The cost has been set at a fee of 30 euros, this was displayed in the airport and confirmed by the driver. The jouney time to the hotel was about 20 mins (make sure you have your seat belt on!) We arrived at the hotel just after 10 and expected the room not to be ready, the hotel advised us to leave our bags and they would place them in the room once ready. We left the hotel and walked to the underground station which was appox 5 mins walk away, purchased a three day ticket for 11 euros and then hopped on the train, all very easy. Two stops to the termini, within 10 mins. Just keep your bags and wallets safe as we warned once again of pickpockets in the area. After a wonderfull day in Rome we returned to the hotel. The room was ready and our bags as promised were taken to our room. The room was compact but had everything you needed for a short stay, the room was very clean and the water pressure in the shower was excellent. The room was equipped with a TV and a fridge, with room to place small bottles of water in. Again for the amount of time spent in the room we found it to be very comfortable. The breakfast is located on the top of the hotel, the staff on duty will make you fresh coffee to start the day, plenty of pastries and cold meet and cheese. Overall i would definitely return to this hotel, the only slight negative is the location, fine for us didnt mind the underground and woiuld return by taxi, the most expensive taxi was 15 euros, not bad for two people. Some guests might find the underground a bit threatening as the trains resemble something out of 70s new york, covered in graffiti, but as i stated we had no problems. would i rebbook yes definitely, all the staff were helpfull and pleasant. one last tip booked a vatican trip and had to queue for 2 hours just to get into the vatican! would not reommend this for small children.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Morgagni - great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hepar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Villa Morgagni for 4 nights and what a great hotel it turned out to be. We arrived at Termini and jumped on the metro to Policlinico - 2 stops later and a 2 min walk, we came to the hotel. The check in service was quick and friendly and our room was big, very clean, and relaxing. As we had booked a family room, the sofa bed (double) was already made up for our daughter. She especially liked the jacuzzi bath and plasma tv. The breakfast on the roof terrace was more than we expected with pastries, cereals, fruit, hams & cheeses, as well as eggs and bacon, which started our day of trekking around Rome. We had a lovely stay here, and definately will be returning. The location is quiet, just what you need from the hustle and bustle of a very busy city.

Reviews.Title: “A Budget Treasure Out of the City Center”
Reviews.Author: ashuppe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Morgagni during a 4 night stay in Rome. Although the hotel is not within walking distance to the sites it is within a 5 minute walk to the metro station. Since Rome has only 2 metro lines it is extremely easy to use and can get you wherever you need to go. We liked to out of the hustle and bustle location of the hotel. It was near a couple of good eateries and a pharmacy across the street. The staff at the hotel were wonderful, spoke English (which was a help), and very friendly. They were able to answer any questions we had. The room was impecable and as we had three windows even in July we got a great breeze in the room. I was impressed with the breakfast as well. Lots of fresh fruit, pastries, meats, cheeses, and drinks. It was served every morning on the rooftop terrace which was a nice way to start the day. Next time we are in Rome we will definitely stay at Villa Morgagni again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SpitfireTraveler
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Villa Morgagni. The hotel is located outside of town, but only a short walk to a stop on the Metro B line. The staff was extremely helpful, especially Federica, who took the time to provide both transportation guidance and dining recommendations. The hotel was clean with a lovely decor and the rooms and bathrooms were relatively spacious. Breakfast was plentiful and was served on a canopied rooftop with a beautiful view. They offered a shuttle service to the airport which was well worth the 70 EURO. Because the hotel is located outside of the town center, options for dining and nightlife are a bit limited, but easily accessible by simply hopping on the metro, bus or Tram. Overall, the hotel served our purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “Villa Morgagni review”
Reviews.Author: travelerCumbria
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel July 2007 and I was very pleased with my stay. We arrived late on an evening flight transfers from Ciampino were very easy and efficient with Terravision to Termini, line B was still open at 2230hrs. 2 stops later the underground station was less than 100yds from the hotel entrance. Although the bar was shut staff gladly allowed me to buy 2 beers and took my case upstairs while I had these. Our room was small but this was compensated for by cleanliness, appearance and quality which were all excellent. We had no terrace but we were on the first floor and there was a small terrace a very short distance from the room and there is also a large terrace on the first floor at the rear of the hotel. There is a roof terrace but this is only open for breakfast between 7am-11am. I thought our breakfast was good quality and there was hottish ham with scrambled egg every morning. Although not central I was pleased with the quiet and relaxed enviroment after spending time in the centre. We needed taxi transport one night after midnight, nearly got caught out by someing posing as a taxi wanting 20 euros but decided to wait in the queue after 10 mins we got a taxi back for just over 7 euros. On out last night we turned right and walked towards the City Centre after 10 minutes we came to an area of hotels and restaurants and we had a very good meal, with very nice staff at a pizza restaurant called Bobo`s. I would definitely use the hotel again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed during Honeymoon, Recommended”
Reviews.Author: MisterSayan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my wife on our honeymoon for 3 nights, and we'd definitely come back next time we're in Rome. This is my first review on TripAdvisor, and I'll try to include some photos I took while here. The room was very comfortable, high cielings, nice design. The aircon worked great, and the curtains allowed us to let in as much or as little light as we liked. Size-wise, it was typical for Europe, which would be a little small for America. But in our case the size was just right. In the bathroom there was a US/Japan compatable outlet for electricity. And a towel rack which kept the towels warm. The breakfast was superb, everything was fresh and great quality. We were in Italy and Switzerland for two weeks, and this was the best breakfast we had. Tthe other places were good, this was just even better. I loved the muselix with fresh fruit and fresh juices, my wife loved the cheeses and fresh salamis, hams, and proscuitto. The croissants were perfect..there's plain, marmelade, and other flavors baked into the center. The skin was perfectly crisp without being dry. For the rest of our honeymoon we never found croissants as good as these, but here we could enjoy them every morning. =) Lots of fresh fruit too. We found out you can order cappucinnos, just ask the lady who works there. Breakfast was actually the best point about this hotel. The location was good, just a minute from the metro (Policlinico station). This station is 2 stops from Termini, and easily accesses all main attractions. So getting to the hotel by taxi was just 5-10 minutes. The area around the hotel was a good neighborhood, and there's a convenience store across the street. If you want a taxi, ask the front desk and it'll be there in just 3-4 minutes. You can wait in the lobby and they'll come get you - this is a nice service about Italy and Switzerland. Taxis are generally prompt and polite. Compared to other hotels in Rome, I felt the price was reasonable considering the location and breakfast. I'd definitely recommend it to friends who visit Rome in the future, and we've already decided to stay here next time. When I have time, I'll write a review of the 2 other Italian hotels I stayed at, as well as the 1 Swiss hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent 5 night stay”
Reviews.Author: michclar
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again without hesitation! One negative you may think is that the hotel is not in the center of Rome. However, if you have ever been to Rome and experienced the hustle and bustle of it all, you may not want to be in the middle of it! The hotel is located in a very nice neighborhood. The hotel is set back from the street which affords it a very quiet atmosphere. Additionally the Policlinico metro stop is literally one block away. The metro can get you to all the key tourist attractions. The rooms are very clean and modern. We had a room with 2 twin beds and the bathroom was luxurious with a sauna tub / shower combo. Both the main room and bathroom were extremely large for European standards. Hotel staff was very friendly and spoke English very well. The free breakfast each morning on the roof patio was such a great service since we really didn't see any breakfast options near the hotel. And what a spread of food they had out! Wireless internet access is available for EUR 6 an hour. The wireless connection is solid but their internet connection times out often and runs a bit slow.

Reviews.Title: “Above all expectations”
Reviews.Author: Citybreakercouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Villa Morgagni in early May 2007 and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We arrived early lunch time and although our room was not ready we used this time to book some trips. Alessandra the Receptionist could not be more helpful and within 5 mins we had booked a trip to the Vatican with Green Line Tours and a walking tour with Enjoy Italy. This was quite a relief as we didn't want to be wandering round the streets of Rome looking for the sites or missing them completly. This was probably the best thing we did as Green Line picked us up from the hotel and the guide had us in and out of the Vatican by noon. Please, please whatever you do don't try and queue up with the masses to see the Sistine Chapel, pay the extra and go with a tour. Once we exited the Vatican Museum there must have been AT LEAST a 2 hour wait to get in if you were doing it yourself. We had the top room, room 401 and although small, everything was spotless and everything matched and well looked after. The benefit of this room was it had an enormous terrace, probably larger than the room itself, this was adjacent to the terraced kitchen area which you didn't notice as it was screened off. The terrace was lovely and the afternoon it didn't rain we managed to sunbathe. The bed was very comfy and we thought larger than a kingsize, we had clean towels everyday of our stay, the bath was a delight as it had a jacuzzi which did create lots of bubbles. The room was air conditioned, but the area in which the hotel is situated is very quiet so you wouldn't hear any street noise. We thought the location suited us, it was very quiet, only 2 stops on the Metro from the main areas, so although you couldn't just walk out to restaurants the hotel recommended a family Trattoria down the road which we both agreed was the best food we had and probably half of the cost of the more commercial areas. So if you are not bothered by jumping on the Metro (buy one ticket for the whole time you are there) or the fact it is slightly out of the way, go to this hotel, away from the madding crowds. We jumped in taxis a few times when the Metro was closed and it only cost 6 Euros to get back. Everyone was very friendly the terrace breakfast terrace was lovely, I can imagine in the Summer it is great, the scrambled egg and bacon fab. ENJOY

Reviews.Title: “Lovely time at Villa Morgagni”
Reviews.Author: SJ_MooreEastAnglia
Reviews.Content: Date 23rd March 2007 - Four days in Rome first time of using trip advisor. Villa Morgagni looked reasonable and I booked on the basis of the reviews I had read. I am glad to say we had a super time, yes the rooms are a tad small but they were clean, fresh and our en-suite also had a bath, a must for hours of slogging the streets of Rome. I had read that the receptionist could be a little frosty and I guess they weren't 'all over us' but they were professional and polite and everything went without a hitch. We found some super places to eat only 10 minutes walk away fairly cheap and family run, a real taste of italy. The breakfasts were well laid out on the covered roof terrace which gave some good views of the hill in the distance. Yummy pastries, and enough to fill up until super-time, if you were greedy enough, the lady who ran this area was very sweet and more than happy to re-fill coffee and cakes. Also 2 minutes from the metro station, very useful to get a 3 day ticket only 11 euros. Strolled around am and pm, never felt threatened or at risk. Would visit Villa Morgagni again.

Reviews.Title: “little gem”
Reviews.Author: exiledscots
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel, rooms although compact , were beautifully furnished and very clean. When I return I will probably upgrade to a larger room for extra comfort. Bathroom spotless. Breakfast room was very nice and food very good for a European style continental breakfast. Staff very friendly and helpful. Hotel is a few minutes walk to the metro which is easy to use and takes you to most of the sights. There are also some good local restaurants if you don't want to go into the city centre every night. Taxi from city centre costs between eight and twelve Euros. We had a great time in Rome and it was great to come back to this quiet haven at night.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - they dont hold reservations”
Reviews.Author: gquasha
Reviews.Content: BEWARE - Booked a room here in February for a May stay and was told in late April that the reservation was canceled and could not be fulfilled. They offered a terrible alternative. Reservations are meaningless here!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: johnrbaxter
Reviews.Content: A great hotel ,close to Metro Station,excellent room and breakfast,friendly staff. Perfect for a short break.

Reviews.Title: “immaculate beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DilsCornwall
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weeks break in Venice and Rome. We arrived at the hotel and the gentleman at the reception was really not very helpful. But, when we got into our room we were very happy. It was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. The only downside being, that there was no bath to soak our aching legs, from hours of sightseeing! But, the shower room was very luxurious and our bed was huge! Breakfast was good, best to get there early as fresh fruit etc seems to run out: lovely roof top breakfast room. The location is ok: a bit further out than we thought, but on the metro line. But, please remember if you use the Metro to stamp your ticket at the begining of your journey, as we didn't realise and nearly ended up at the police station ! We would recommend this hotel to young couples/families. We were very please with it

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay at Villa Morgagni”
Reviews.Author: Munster-Gal
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 night stay at The Villa Morgagni and were very pleased with the experience. Room: We stayed in a "Smart Room" on the 2nd floor which was situated to the rear of the hotel. The room was spotlessly clean, comfortably furnished and of a more than adequate size. There was air-con, a plasma TV with channels in english & a mini-bar which we didn't use but seemed well stocked with the usual refreshments. The wardrobe space was fine & there was a safe in the room. Beds & pillows were comfy & the sheets were egyptian cotton. Bathroom: The bathroom was finished in marble with good fittings power shower over the hydromassage bath, bidet, single sink, heated towel rail and pull-out shaving mirror with light. Staff: All the staff we met were friendly, helpful & efficient. We were always greeted with a smile & any queries we had were answered patiently and thoroughly. Breakfast: Tasty & varied buffet style served on the 4th floor roof garden. The usual selection of bread, pastries, salami, yogurt, juices, cereals etc. with bacon & eggs also available. Freshly made cappuccinos & espressos were provided on request and delivered to your table by a charming lady. Location: Some reviewers found fault with the location but this didn't bother us at all because we found the metro so handy for getting around during the day.The hotel is in a quiet area tucked just off the main street. There is a metro stop 2 minutes walk away and a bus stop just up the street. It's only 2 stops to Termini - the main station & from there you can get to anywhere in Rome or indeed Italy for that matter. Taxi to Trevi Fountain costs about €8. We enjoyed our stay so much we'll definitely be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Villa Morgagni was a delight!!”
Reviews.Author: Golf_World_Traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and very clean. The staff was mostly helpful especially the breakfast ladies. They really cheered up everybody in the morning. They put out a very nice breakfast spread. Croisants, great capuccinos!, cereals, ham and eggs, fruit, and lots of others stuff. I had the single and was quite small but very nicely decorated. The staff cleaned and maintained the rooms very well. The subway stop "Policlinico" is only a block away and the bus #61 which runs to Piazza Spagna. There is also a cafeteria across the street which serves great lunches - local style and cheap compared to the tourist traps. I stayed there for a week and loved every night of it - nice and quiet! I highly recommend this hotel. The only thing that was negative was one lady worked at the reception - one morning (must be working parttime) - she was very rude, didn't smile and as if she was doing me a big favor for asking her something. Thank god she only worked there one day. The rest of the staff were very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and very comfortable hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Ritabix
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night recently (25th August) and was extremely impressed by the decor, ambiance and comfort level. Tucked down a little driveway near a very busy road it is very hard to hear the traffic once inside. Having read various good reviews on this site I booked a single room on venere.com and got a really good rate of euro 70 including full buffet breakfast. My room was very small but with high ceilings and long window it didnt feel so bad. The shower room was almost as big as the bedroom and was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. There is an air conditioning system and a mini bar. They also have a turkish bath on the premises but as I was already sweltering in 33 degrees of 'natural' heat I gave it a miss.! Breakfast is served on a lovley rooftop terrace. There is a fairly extensive cold buffet and the very pleasant waitress made capuccini to order. My only disapointment was when leaving when I asked the receptionist for change for the metro (underground) . She was rather unhelpful saying they didnt have any change at reception or in the bar and suggested I go to a nearby atm machine (which of course only gives out notes). I left a little unimpressed but found a newsagent's stall just across the road where I bought a card for only 1 euro (single fare for all journeys). The Metro station (Policlinico) on the B line is about 3 minutes walk away and only 2 stops from Rome's main train station, Termini. Check times of last trains out of this station at night.

Reviews.Title: “Grazie, Villa Morgagni!”
Reviews.Author: Mhjin
Reviews.Content: We were so happy with the Villa Morgagni during our stay in September 2005, I've suggested it to everyone traveling to Rome. It was ideally situated outside of the hustle and bustle of the city center - and just a short metro ride to the attractions around Rome. Our room was extremely tidy and a great size for 2 - with a very good sized marble bathroom and a safe/TV/ammenities. I had heard horror stories about hotels near the train station, so I was very happy to be a bit farther outside of town to enjoy nicer accomodations at a reasonable price. While there isn't much for tourists to do in the Policlinico area, I thought it was an ideal location for a hotel. The metro was barely a block away. I am surprised at some of the descriptions of the breakfast, because I was very impressed. Not only is it "all you can eat "- it's included in the price of the room and it included many different types of fruit, cheese, loads of cereals, delicious croissants, made to order espresso, and there were hot dishes, too. I've even included a photo! It really started the day off on a great note to enjoy a cappucino overlooking the city on the open air terrace. We really enjoyed the nearby Gran Sasso, upon the concierge's suggestion. Our first bucatini all'amatriciana , and we were hooked! We will definitely return to the Villa Morgagni!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. It's not in the centre of Rome, however it's very near a train station. Also, as Rome is so tiny, we were able to walk from the city centre to the hotel in about 20 minutes, so it really isn't that far at all. The room was furnished very sophisticatedly with marble in the bathroom, it's also a very good size. The bathroom was very big, definitely larger than average, and the room was also a very good size, especially for hotels in Europe. The room had everything that you require, TV, hairdryer, fridge, air conditioning and safe. The staff at the hotel are incredibly friendly and very helpful. Before we arrived at the hotel I informed them that we would require an early check-in as we arrived at the hotel around 11am. They were wonderful with this, when we arrived at the hotel we found our room ready for us. Also, the staff at the hotel were wonderful with advising us of places to visit, how to get there, where the night life is, etc. One man gave us detailed instructions as to where the night life is and what bus we needed to take to get there. Another lady gladly rang up a tour operator for us to find out where we could take the bus from and then told us how to get there. The only let down was breakfast as there wasn't much choice, however this really wasn't a big deal and the croissants were very nice! We would definitely stay at this hotel again and will recommend it to anyone we know going to Rome. It's great value for money, an absolutely lovely hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel recently in room 205, one of their smart rooms, which we would recommend. The room is large and well appointed as all the previous visitors have said. The hotel is lovely, very clean and comfortable, The location is off the beaten track which wasn't a problem during the day as the metro is across the street. A 4 euro day ticket will allow you to jump on and off the metro till midnight and tickets can be bought from machines at the station. However, the metro line B stops at 9PM so going to the center at night, you will need to use a taxi or bus. It might be an idea to get hold of a bus timetable and routes before a visit. We didn't try walking because Rome in July is HOT (36 C) ! Although our room didn't have a terrace, there is a small, terrace with 2 tables and parasol off the first floor which allowed us to sit out at night. The room is air conditioned but this switches off if you open a window. We found that after closing the window, it is worth switching the air conditioning off and then on again . The staff are very friendly and our lack of Italian wasn't a problem. Breakfast is good and if you ask they will make you as many cappuchinos as you like . Gran Sasso is the nearest restaurant to the hotel and is OK .
