However, if you turn left after leaving the hotel and walk about half a mile to Via Arezzo ( not sure about the spelling) and look left down the the street there is a little restaurant called Il Tunnel. It doesn't look grand but we had as nice a meal there as anywhere in Rome and very reasonably priced. We would definitely stay at this hotel again and if they could keep the metro line open till late this would be the perfect place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Morgagni on the Metro”
Reviews.Author: jumper79
Reviews.Content: Very upscale looking hotel. The rooms were very nice but TINY. The breakfast spread was adequate. The one problem we had was not with the hotel itself but with the location. Although we were only located a block from the metro(which we did use to get to the Colesseum) not being fluent in Italian made things somewhat stressful in finding out where to get tickets, what stations to get off at, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: helyn32
Reviews.Content: It is definitely worth the small trek to the center of Rome to stay at Villa Morgagni. The hotel is VERY conveniently located near that Metro and it took my boyfriend and I only fifteen minutes to get here from Termini Station. The neighborhood is QUIET and our bedroom window opened out onto a lovely courtyard. A 11-euro cab ride or a five-minute train ride brought us to all the big sights in Rome. The "surly" receptionist was fine and did not deter our enjoyment of the accomodations. The elevator is, typically, small. The room was not large either. However, beautiful marble covered our bathrooms and we found the appliances to be new and luxurious compared to other Italian hotels. A small vanity was the only furniture in our "smart" room but this was fine as we spent most of the day outside of the hotel. Breakfast was one of the best we experienced. Meats, cheeses, juices, rolls, danishes, croissants, coffees...all served on their roofdeck. Breakfast is not to be missed (comparatively speaking, of course).

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in the end of April. Our room 203 was very small, but clean. We were told that it is a double, not a single as someone here mentioned earlier. I was disappointed as I've never stayed in a room that small, nowhere in Europe nor in America. The air conditioning (a bit noisy) had to be on all the time due to the smell of some detergent. The terrace breakfast was nice, although everything was packed besides the croissants, fruit, and eggs. We bought 3 day metro passes, but as the line B does not operate in the night time, we also took a taxi. Next time I will book a hotel room closer to the historical centre even if it is much more expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mil4d
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Hotel Villa Morgagni in January this year for 6 nights. The room we stayed in is charming and spacious. The spa bath is wonderful after a long day walking around Rome. The breakfast consists of pastries, breadrolls cold meat, cheese, fruits, juice, some hot food and coffee or tea. The hotel is a short distant from the town centre. However, it is still close enough to walk to most attractions and for us to go back and have a rest in the afternoon. It took us on average 10-15 minutes to walk to the termini. We tried a different route each day and got to see different sights along the way. The underground station is not far from the hotel. There is a lovely restaurant not far from the hotel called Gran Sasso (the reception has details of the restaurant). We had two very enjoyable meals there and the menu is reasonably priced. We found the staff extremely helpful and friendly. If you are staying in Rome for a few days then this is a great place to stay. It is nice to come back to a quiet and peaceful hotel to have a break before venturing out again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel way off the beaten path”
Reviews.Author: rjonuws
Reviews.Content: Very nice, very quiet 4 star hotel, located North east of downtown Rome. The room (I had a single) was very small, but also very clean, and nicely furnished,decorated. Free breakfast with decent spread is served on roof top dining area. The hotel has a sauna/turkish bath, but I did not use. The hotel is not walkable to any sights. The nearest stop (which is literally around the corner) is Metro A Policlinico stop (which is 2 stops from Termini Train station, and 4 stops from Colliseum). If you want a quiet, clean , 3/4 star hotel for a decent price, stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain”
Reviews.Author: jwelsh
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, this hotel was an outstanding bargain. The room was large, clean and tastefully furnished, the staff were pleasant (for the most part - there was one surly receptionist, but we hardly saw her), the location was quiet, and the breakfast was excellent. I've paid twice as much for hotels that were half as good as Villa Morgagni.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant Receptionist Ruined the Experience”
Reviews.Author: AccidentalAmerican
Reviews.Content: Originally I wanted to stay two nights at the Villa Morgagni. Fortunately, the hotel was not available the first evening. The hotel itself was fine. The single was small, decorated with matching bedspread and wallpaper and faux antique furniture. My stay, though, was ruined by the surly receptionist. She checked me in while she continued with her personal phone call. I had to wait until she finished her call before I could speak to her. She not only was rude, but she gave me the wrong information of where to catch the bus. Normally, I don't need perky and helpful staff, and wouldn't pay much heed to whether the staff was rude, but this woman was downright hostile. I simply wanted to avoid any interaction with her, but unfortunately, she was the sole interface between the guests and the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not miss out on this great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TTToronto
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Rome before so i read numerous reviews before i booked with this hotel. i got a great deal booking directly through the hotel website. This hotel was amazing! it certainly lived up to its 4* european rating!! the sheets were very high quality and i slept like a baby each night (i was there for 6 nights in October). It was spotless and the decor was very nice. The room was a bit small (i was in room 203 - a single) but for one person, i didn't need the extra space. There was a safe in the room which was also good. The breakfast on the upstairs patio was a great start to each day - there was a combination of hot and cold food and i agree the croissants were spectacular! The staff recommended a number of very good local restaurants and i had the best food for reasonable rates - i spent about 16 euro each night for dinner, although it was a challenge conversing since very little to no english was spoken (not being in a tourist area and all). I loved the location of the hotel - it was only 2 stops from termini on the B line (Policlinico stop) yet it seemed so far removed from all the noise and tourists! i was still able to walk to a lot of the attractions (with comfortable shoes of course!) - also the 61 bus passed right in front of the hotel and went to the main attractions as well. I definitely recommend this hotel for price, quality and location....do not miss out on this one!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning place”
Reviews.Author: HayleyFord
Reviews.Content: What a great place. We had room 301 which is a 'smart room' so had a spa bath in. It was stunning! The room was big enough for us to be comfortable and had a plasma screen which was nice. The hotel do the most amazing croisants ever which I must have eaten a ton of. I would definately recommend spending a bit extra on the 'smart rooms' as it was lovely. Just wanted to make a note about the convenience issue. We were in Rome for only two days and managed to see everything we wanted to see. Although not in the heart of things, it was nice to be out of the busy streets of Rome. From here you are only 4 stops to Colleseum on line b and 6 stops or so to the vatican on line a, so we travelled one way and then walked back passing all the sites on the way. In the evenings you can wander (about ten minute walk or short cab ride) to the areas of Castro and Pretorio (just look on a map of Rome and you will see them) and there were at least ten different restaurants to go to. They are totally off the tourist track so really good food and great value. I would suggest you get a pocket phrase book to help with the food descriptions though as the they understandably dont always have the english translations on their menu's. One place we need to mention was called 'Al Padovana' which is on Via Bergamo which is a typical old italian trattoria which did an antipasti to die and delicious prawns. We had wine and three courses and our bill was about 40 Euro so really reasonable, considering one of the places we went for lunch in one of the main piazza's cost us 30 euro for two sloppy pizzas and two cokes (incidentally 5 euro each!).

Reviews.Title: “A Rough Start, But Good Overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Villa Morgagni is a fairly nice place to stay in Rome. The best part about this hotel is its location. It's very near the subway station but far enough away from all the activity that it's quiet and relaxing. The hotel sits back away from the street so, there's very little noise during the night. The major problem we had was with our air conditioning. We checked in on a Saturday afternoon and by Sunday, our air conditioning had quit altogether. We were told, through the language barrier, that since it was Sunday, there was no one available to fix the AC. It was about 85 degrees outside that day so we had to literally BEG for another room. After this was granted, we were not given much hospitality for the remainder of our stay. The decorations in this hotel are very nice, not my taste, but very European. It was a very clean hotel but don't expect too much space. As with all European hotels, the rooms here are very small. There were three of us staying in a "double" room which meant no more space, just a pull out couch. The bathrooms are also quite small but still very clean. The balconies are very spacious...a great place to go sit to get away from being cramped. Don't bother trying to get help with your phone card...they don't know what you're asking for. The breakfast on the upstairs terrace was a great amenity...made the day a lot better when you don't have to start by looking for something to eat. There are few restaurants close by so, if you stay here eat BEFORE you come back for the day. All in all, I would rate this hotel "average".

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Villa Morgagni was a great place to stay in Rome. It is located 2 Metro stations from the main metro and train station. It is away from the touristy area, which made it a nice place to relax in the evening. When we first arrived, we were able to check in early. The staff was very helpful in providing us with a breakfast before heading out for the day. The room was small by American standards, but was clean, nicely decorated and comfortable. The bathroom was also on the small side, but it was tastefully decorated with marble. The breakfast buffet was very good with a variety of breads, croisants, yogurt, cereal, juice, coffee and teas. The staff was very friendly. My only disappointment was that the front desk could not cash traveler's checks for us. They also didn't have any site seeing tour information. I would highly recommend this hotel when staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “4* Hotel located on the quiet side of Rome”
Reviews.Author: halifaxlass
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Villa Morgagni the 2nd week in June. I was travelling with my mother and 6 month old baby. The hotel is 4* and beautifully decorated and lovely marble floors. The staff are very helpful and speak very good english. The room was very nice with air conditioning and a lovely marble bathroom with spa bath. the room was a little on the small side but it was no problem. Breakfast was servered on the rooftop terrace which was lovely, and had a very nice selection of cheeses and pastries and cooked meats. The only drawback is the rooftop terrace is not open in the evening. The hotel is in a very quiet location, and lacks a choice of restaurants. this is the only drawback staying here, but there is the metro nearby to travel into the centre and all the attractions etc and its on and a good bus route. I would stay there again if I go back to Rome as it was a good price for a 4* hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Morgagni
HotelInfo.Address: Via G B Morgagni 25, 00161 Rome, Italy
